sub_title: Executive Coordinator at Nepal Sathi Pratisthan
summary:
Stichting Nepal Sathi (Nepal Sathi Foundation, Sathi hereafter) is founded by a group of academics, who come from diverse backgrounds, but are motivated by the same one goal of helping people (in Nepal). Sathi team has formulated two-tier approach: a) Sathi continuously offers a ‘good’ education to poor rural/urban children so that they can become knowledgeable leaders to develop their communities, & b) it constantly encourages qualified young people to start projects that are useful to their own people by seeking financial/technical support various NGOs, including Sathi. Some of the projects well under way are:
1) Helping disadvantaged children to attend school wherever possible
2) School Projects in rural areas
3) Helping to Build Secure Toilets
4) Goats/Chicken Husbandry
5) Adult Literacy Classes
7) Environmental and Health Awareness Support

And much more in the future (see http://www.nepalsathi.ws)

Sathi team is also cooperating with Nepal Sathi Pratisthan (NSP) for Knowledge Exchange in Nepal (KEN) with the following objectives: 

o Sharing theoretical/practical knowledge and skills on different issues of development cooperation, organizing face-to-face interactions, workshops, seminars or exposure visits on different contemporary issues of development among academic institutions, students, and development practitioners in Nepal.
o Facilitate and organize placement of abroad students in the Nepalese NGOs for internship, writing thesis and conduct research studies in the area of their interest. o Exchanging ideas with Nepalese students, especially among those taking developmental or livelihood studies, by way of teaching, jointly conducting fieldwork or doing practical assignments.
o Volunteer teaching and/or providing practical trainings at schools/vocational institutions or NGOs/community supported programmes, and/or getting involved in physical projects related to education, health and environment in rural or urban areas.

Specialties: Education, Environment, and Health Projects; Volunteering in Rural and Urban Areas; Placement for Students and Researchers
